content: through each of the stitches in the last round and pull the hole closed but still loose like top side insert needle through center and all the way through the saucer pulling through center hole of top side pull yarn with enough gauge to flatten the saucer but not too tightly it should look like a puffy disc not a ball or a donut maintaining desired gauge embroider a 6-pointed starburst pattern inserting the needle for each point between the sts of rounds 1 and 2 see image now go over each loop again loosely to gain more volume see image below insert needle into center hole and back through saucer pulling through center hole into the body of the saucer and pull needle out the center hole of the top side pulling of underside be careful not to pull too tightly and squash your saucer any further through most of the yarn make french knot with 4 wraps when completing this repeat starburst embroidery on this side the saucer stitches will look different here french knot draw needle through the saucer and out the center hole on the underside so do your best to imitate the shape and size of the first starburst you embroidered on not pulling to tightly make another french knot here with 4 wraps fasten_off yarn top and cut or leave long tails available for finishing embroidery fasten_off yarn and cut do not do any more embroidery on the saucer until after assembly using black yarn with length of yarn at least 24 long embroider a circle using the 6 points of your stardrive section starbursts around gray starburst embroidery on top side and also on underside of saucer again be careful not to pull too tightly while passing yarn from top to bottom of make one saucer fasten_off yarn and cut or leave long tail available for later embroidery using gray yarn using white yarn round 1 magic_ring 8 or ch2 then work 8 single_crochet into 1st st - 8 sts thread length of yarn at least 24 long onto tapestry needle insert needle somewhere if using magic_ring pull center hole mostly closed but still loose you ll need to leave space for much embroidery to pass through it round 2 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 3 sts 2 times - 10 sts remove marker and sl next st chain 1 and turn work piece round 3 in flo single_crochet into 3rd st from hook replace marker into st just made single_crochet in flo of next 9 sts- 10 sts remove marker and sl next st using both loops chain 1 and turn round 4 single_crochet into 3rd st from hook replace marker into st just made single_crochet in next 9 sts 10 sts round 5 remove marker single_crochet into that st and replace marker into st just made single_crochet in next 3 sts inv decrease single_crochet into next 4 sts 9 sts rounds 6 10 single_crochet around 9 sts stuff
